newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil April coffee exports 1.21 mln bags - Febec.
newsitem.headline: Brazil April coffee exports 1.21 mln bags - Febec.

text.p: Brazil exported 1.21 million 60-kg bags of coffee, ground and in beans, in April, down from an adjusted March figure of 1.54 million bags, said Brazilian Federation of Coffee Exporters (Febec).
Previously, Febec estimated March exports at 1.53 million bags.
The April total is more than twice the 543,435 bags exported in the same month in 1996.
Brazilian exports so far this year have reached 5.12 million bags, more than twice the 2.31 million bags shipped in the first four months of 1996.
Revenue has more than doubled to $862.82 million from $337.81 million earned in January/April 1996. Revenue last month was $247.36 million against $87.24 million in April last year.
The average price per bag rose to $202.73 in April compared with $184.50 in March, Febec said.
Of April's total, 1.18 million bags were arabica coffee, while shipments of conillon reached 37,500 bags. ((-Caroline Bulloch, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 5074151))
